text: Not a bad idea for our events blog posts: <https://addthisevent.com/>
i always really appreciate that feature when it's available
We used this for the Small Batch site and it caused a few problems. We could make something similar that is way better and nicer.
we should!
Or we could link to something like the event's <http://nvite.com|nvite.com> page. Would be worth exploring what we want the user flow to be for this.
that's true. if we want the ability to have a guest list etc then something like that might be the way to go
we could also do both... i might want to add something to my calendar that i'm not sure i'll attend.
Yes, also, are we going to start writing blog posts before an event to advertise it?
we have in the past
i dont know what the plan for event marketing is
that's a great question for danielle

One thing to consider is that if we had 1 event per week and maybe 1 regular blog post every 1/2 months our feed would be filled with events. Don't know if that is good or bad but worth thinking about.
that would point to an event calendar / events section of the site
Agreed.
we won't be promoting events that are hosted at uncorked, simply uncorked original events which will happen much less frequently
we'll keep an events section of the site in consideration
good point on not promoting external events
<@U02HCCTFL>: See above for question on event promotion
<@U02HCCTFL|danielle> has joined the channel
I think having a place where people can see a list of upcoming events is snazzy
a blog post is what we've used historically because we lack that functionality
i like post-event blog posts too - give us an opportunity to capture highlights
speaking of which, here's our Intel Hackathon blogpost: <http://uncorkedstudios.com/blog/intel-uncorked-iot-hackathon>

attachments.title: Uncorked Studios Blog Intel & Uncorked IOT Hackathon
attachments.text: We were invited to participate in an IOT hackathon hosted by Intel last week. The products focused on digital asset management and the role that IOT devices could play in facilitating their development.
attachments.fallback: Uncorked Studios: Uncorked Studios Blog Intel & Uncorked IOT Hackathon

text: marce can you tweet about that as well?
i can - could someone help me resize the header image first?
it's a little stuttery
@marce, send it to me and I'll try to fix it. biggest version you've got if possible
and good looks on the shirt by josh
cool - i can resize too and reupload - wasn't sure if you guys were doing that programmatically
i think they are, but it may help if we start from the template
try it at  3360 PX WIDE
cool will do that
sorry I didn't use the template
current size I have is 3000 x 2000
it may not matter, as this post does the same thing <http://uncorkedstudios.com/blog/getting-back-to-craft-giving-back-to-colleagues>

text: i can increase it (i don't think you'll lose resolution too much)
this is where I start to not know what the hell i'm talking about, but I'd probably rather we didn't upsize. <@U02618EV1>, do you have any thoughts?
it didn't change too much. original image I have is here:
if anyone wants to jam on it. i'll tweet in the meantime
i think it may just be par for the course (huge image and animation), but i think it looks great. Also, I LOVE your teaser image.
Just catching up. Is the problem that things look a bit jumpy?
yeah, and i know we've talked about before
I think that's just product of having a huge image with that slight parallax effect.
i can use a different image too
we've got options
Happens on all other posts with the same effect.
cool - wasn't sure if it was me. :simple_smile:
No <@U026NB2U2>. You did everything right. I'll look into it and see if we can speed it up.

There's definitely something going on here. It's very stuttery on  <@U026NB2U2>'s laptop (newer machine) and an old Mac Pro but it's smooth on my laptop. It also affects other posts so I'm investigating to see how to fix it.
stuttery on mine, FWIW
Thanks for checking <@U0260V1BX>. When you have a sec can you look at  <http://192.168.168.189:2317/blog/intel-uncorked-iot-hackathon> and see if you notice any improvements?
looks way better on mine
still stuttery for me
Way better for me.
Exactly.
At this point how important is it to have that parallax effect vs. using the hours that may take to fix it towards Hercules?
don't worry about hercules
i doubt we'll be doing that anyway. thanks for improving galapagos though.

i think gaston is asking if we should we turn off the paralax on the current site to make sure it looks good for everyone rather than trying to fix it. that way he can spend more time working on the upcoming site versus fixing the current.

Sorry, what I meant to ask was: Would it make more sense to turn this animation off altogether since it looks like it's gotten considerably worse with Yosemite and focus my time on Hercules dev polish or do we want to leave the animation on in which case I should look into was to make it fluid for all/most visitors?
absolutely
kill dat beyotch
Sounds great. Thank you all.
